title: 104_hr3117
content: AUTHORITY TO ESTABLISH AND OPERATE MANAGED HEALTH-CARE PLANS. The Secretary may establish managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, to provide health services to veterans in accordance with prescribed standards. Minimum health care benefits must be provided to veterans enrolled in the plan. The Secretary may establish managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, to provide health services to veterans with minimum health benefits including those covered under Medicare. The Secretary can enroll veterans in the plan and set cost-sharing requirements to cover additional costs. Payments received for care provided under the plan will be used to cover the costs of care. Operating a plan under this section is restricted annually. The Secretary may establish managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, to provide health services to veterans with minimum health benefits. The Secretary can enroll veterans in the plan and set cost-sharing requirements. Operating a plan under this section is restricted annually based on the availability of medical care funds at Department facilities. Establishment of managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, to provide health services to veterans with minimum health benefits. Payment for certain services provided by Department facilities is required. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will make Medicare payments to Department managed health care plans for certain veterans who are Medicare-eligible individuals. Managed health care plans providing care to these veterans will be certified as Medicare Choice organizations. The Secretary certifies Department managed health care plans that meet standards under section 1705. Medicare payments are made to these plans for Medicare-eligible veterans. Managed health care plans are certified as Medicare Choice organizations. Medicare payments for certain veterans under Section 1729A of title 38, United States Code, apply to care provided after the enactment of this Act.
